intro: Periarrabidaea truncata, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features palmately compound leaves and produces yellow flowers with five sepals and petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its attractive appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
